googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Pennsylvania driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your PA driver’s license number.  If you don't have one, enter the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have either number, write "NONE" in this space.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Pennsylvania can request an absentee ballot ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth  
210 North Office Bldg.  
Harrisburg, PA 17120‐0029
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Most Pennsylvania voters don't need to show ID at the polls.  If you are voting for the first time in your county, you might need to show ID.  Acceptable forms of photo-ID include a non-expired drivers license from any state, a military ID, a student ID, a US passport, or any other government issued photo ID.  Acceptable forms of non-photo ID include a current utility bill, bank statement, pay statement, car registration, rent receipt, government check, or other government document that shows your name and Pennsylvania address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party’s primary election.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Pennsylvania driver's license or state ID card. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox8: This information is requested but not required.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm:
Pennsylvania requires you to provide your PA driver’s license or PennDOT ID number or the last four digits of your Social Security on your **absentee ballot application**.  If you don't have any of these numbers, you must provide a COPY of a photo ID with your application or with your voted ballot.  Your ID must show your name, your photo, and an expiration date.  

Acceptable form of ID include: 

* Any photo ID issued by the state of Pennsylvania or the federal government, including an employee ID card
* A Pennsylvania voter ID card
* A student ID issued by an accredited college, university, trade school
* A military ID
* A photo ID issued by a long-term care facility, assisted living residence, or personal care home
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Pennsylvania you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States at least one month before the next election
  * be a resident of Pennsylvania and your election district at least 30 days before Election Day
  * be at least 18 years of age on the day of the next election
  * not be incarcerated after conviction for a felony (your voting rights are restored immediately after incarceration)
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationDeadlineMail: Received 15 days prior to an election
